meanings.definition: To make a gesture with the hand, head, or other body part to encourage someone to come nearer or follow.
meanings.sent1: She becked her friend to join her at the park.
meanings.sent2: The teacher becked the students to gather around for a story.
meanings.sent3: The dog becked its tail excitedly, wanting to play fetch.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse becked ships safely to shore in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The warm light becked weary travelers to the cozy inn.

meanings.definition: To give a signal or indication.
meanings.sent1: The traffic light becked the cars to stop.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds becked the impending rain.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock becked the start of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums becked the approaching parade.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread becked customers into the bakery.

meanings.sent1: The wizard becked his apprentice for an important task.
meanings.sent2: The king becked his subjects to the grand hall.
meanings.sent3: The phone becked her to answer with its persistent ringing.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual becked forth spirits from the beyond.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the flute becked animals from the forest to listen.
